page.title: 03INDUSTRIAL DECLINE 1
page.content: The most striking feature of the area, is the evidence of former industrial endeavour. The landscape is scarred by the remains of old quarries used for extracting limestone, ironstone and fireclays. By the all too obvious debris of 'open cast' mining, as well as the mounds of slag from coal pits, now grown over as the last of them closed around 1970. In talking to people in their 60's and 70's, one is given an impression of the area as it might have been 50 years ago. When all adult males in Horsehay and Doseley were employed in the iron and engineering works, the Horsehay Co. Ltd or 'Simpson's', as it was known, after the local patrician family.
